title: information graphics?
content:
I sort of understnd what they are and see some examples online, but can anyone point me to some really good information graphics?

 [‹ Font used in BT Shop catalogue](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50371 "Go to previous forum topic") [A bold font, what can it be? - image attached. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50372 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fredcastle

comments.content:
Hi Fred,  
 [Edward Tufte](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.edwardtufte.com/tufte/)  
 [Visual Complexity](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.visualcomplexity.com/vc/)

Older typophile threads: [[1]](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/typophile.com/node/12268), [[2]](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/typophile.com/node/18470)  
F

Great, thanks.

If anyone else has other random links or tips, please post.

A collection from my bookmarks. I might have more, but I have so many bookmarks. ;)

[Box Office Movie Charts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.xach.com/moviecharts/)  
 [A thread on another forum with lots of infographics](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.qbn.com/topics/554523/?page=2)  
 [Simple Complexity](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/simplecomplexity.net/)  
 [A blog where infographics are often posted](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.designingthenews.com/2008/03/17/visualisations-and-infographics/)  
 [Information Aesthetics](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/infosthetics.com/)  
 [The Virtual Water Project](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.traumkrieger.de/virtualwater/)  
 [HistoryShots](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.historyshots.com/index.cfm)  
 [International Networks Archive world issue charts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/www.princeton.edu/~ina/infographics/)  
 [We Feel Fine: An exploration of human emotion, in six movements](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121120617/http:/wefeelfine.org/)
